intro: Stylidium schoenoides, commonly known as the common sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. Stylidium schoenoides is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
